column1: Kinder Morgan Expanding Eagle Ford Pipeline Systems
column2: Supplying 2 Bcf/d of Gas to Gulf Coast Markets | Pipeline and Gas Journal;;https://pgjonline.com/news/2023/july/kinder-morgan-expanding-eagle-ford-pipeline-systems-supplying-2-bcfd-of-gas-to-gulf-coast-markets;;Kinder Morgan
column6: Eagle Ford Midstream LP;;Yes;;Kinder Morgan and Howard Energy Partners are collaborating on an expansion project called the Eagle Ford project. This project aims to expand the Eagle Ford natural gas transportation systems by constructing pipelines and facilities. The goal is to deliver up to 2 billion cubic feet per day of natural gas to Gulf Coast markets. The completion of these projects is expected by the fourth quarter of 2023. This expansion will provide a critical supply link to meet the growing demand in the area. Dos Caminos
column7: a joint venture between HEP and Eagle Ford Midstream LP
column8: is also involved in delivering natural gas to the U.S. Gulf Coast markets.

column1: CPC Adopts New Regulations on Tanker Loadings in Its Marine Terminal | Pipeline and Gas Journal;;https://pgjonline.com/news/2023/july/cpc-adopts-new-regulations-on-tanker-loadings-in-its-marine-terminal;;Caspian Pipeline Consortium
column6: Chevron Caspian Pipeline Consortium Company;;Yes;;The Caspian Pipeline Consortium (CPC) has implemented new regulations to reduce loading speeds of oil tankers during changing weather conditions in order to minimize air pollution. These regulations have not caused any disruptions or delays in oil loadings from the CPC terminal. Kazakhstan plans to increase oil exports through the CPC system by 8.7% this year. The court has suspended activity for 30 days due to issues related to oil spills. CPC is a major export route for Kazakhstan's crude oil
column7: with its endpoint in Russia. The main shareholders in CPC include Transneft
column9: and Chevron Caspian Pipeline Consortium Company.
